00024 /* this code liberated and modified from lnet/lnet/router_proc.c */
00025 
00026 #define DEBUG_SUBSYSTEM S_LND
00027 #include "gnilnd.h"
00028 #include <linux/seq_file.h>
00029 #include <lprocfs_status.h>
00030 
00031 #define GNILND_PROC_STATS       "stats"
00032 #define GNILND_PROC_MDD         "mdd"
00033 #define GNILND_PROC_SMSG        "smsg"
00034 #define GNILND_PROC_CONN        "conn"
00035 #define GNILND_PROC_PEER_CONNS  "peer_conns"
00036 #define GNILND_PROC_PEER        "peer"
00037 #define GNILND_PROC_CKSUM_TEST  "cksum_test"
00038 
00039 static int
00040 _kgnilnd_proc_run_cksum_test(int caseno, int nloops, int nob)
00041 {
00042         lnet_kiov_t              *src, *dest;
00043         struct timespec          begin, end, diff;
00044         int                      niov;
00045         int                      rc = 0;
00046         int                      i = 0, j = 0, n;
00047         __u16                    cksum, cksum2;
00048         __u64                    mbytes;
00049 
00050         LIBCFS_ALLOC(src, LNET_MAX_IOV * sizeof(lnet_kiov_t));
00051         LIBCFS_ALLOC(dest, LNET_MAX_IOV * sizeof(lnet_kiov_t));
00052 
00053         if (src == NULL || dest == NULL) {
00054                 CERROR("couldn't allocate iovs\n");
00055                 GOTO(unwind, rc = -ENOMEM);
00056         }
00057 
00058         for (i = 0; i < LNET_MAX_IOV; i++) {
00059                 src[i].kiov_offset = 0;
00060                 src[i].kiov_len = PAGE_SIZE;
00061                 src[i].kiov_page = alloc_page(__GFP_WAIT | __GFP_IO |
00062                                               __GFP_FS | __GFP_ZERO);
00063 
00064                 if (src[i].kiov_page == NULL) {
00065                         CERROR("couldn't allocate page %d\n", i);
00066                         GOTO(unwind, rc = -ENOMEM);
00067                 }
00068 
00069                 dest[i].kiov_offset = 0;
00070                 dest[i].kiov_len = PAGE_SIZE;
00071                 dest[i].kiov_page = alloc_page(__GFP_WAIT | __GFP_IO |
00072                                               __GFP_FS | __GFP_ZERO);
00073 
00074                 if (dest[i].kiov_page == NULL) {
00075                         CERROR("couldn't allocate page %d\n", i);
00076                         GOTO(unwind, rc = -ENOMEM);
00077                 }
00078         }
00079 
00080         /* add extra 2 pages - one for offset of src, 2nd to allow dest offset */
00081         niov = (nob / PAGE_SIZE) + 2;
00082         if (niov > LNET_MAX_IOV) {
00083                 CERROR("bytes %d too large, requires niov %d > %d\n",
00084                         nob, niov, LNET_MAX_IOV);
00085                 GOTO(unwind, rc = -E2BIG);
00086         }
00087 
00088         /* setup real data */
00089         src[0].kiov_offset = 317;
00090         dest[0].kiov_offset = 592;
00091         switch (caseno) {
00092         default:
00093                 /* odd -> even */
00094                 break;
00095         case 1:
00096                 /* odd -> odd */
00097                 dest[0].kiov_offset -= 1;
00098                 break;
00099         case 2:
00100                 /* even -> even */
00101                 src[0].kiov_offset += 1;
00102                 break;
00103         case 3:
00104                 /* even -> odd */
00105                 src[0].kiov_offset += 1;
00106                 dest[0].kiov_offset -= 1;
00107         }
00108         src[0].kiov_len = PAGE_SIZE - src[0].kiov_offset;
00109         dest[0].kiov_len = PAGE_SIZE - dest[0].kiov_offset;
00110 
00111         for (i = 0; i < niov; i++) {
00112                 memset(page_address(src[i].kiov_page) + src[i].kiov_offset,
00113                        0xf0 + i, src[i].kiov_len);
00114         }
00115 
00116         lnet_copy_kiov2kiov(niov, dest, 0, niov, src, 0, nob);
00117 
00118         getnstimeofday(&begin);
00119 
00120         for (n = 0; n < nloops; n++) {
00121                 CDEBUG(D_BUFFS, "case %d loop %d src %d dest %d nob %d niov %d\n",
00122                        caseno, n, src[0].kiov_offset, dest[0].kiov_offset, nob, niov);
00123                 cksum = kgnilnd_cksum_kiov(niov, src, 0, nob - (n % nob), 1);
00124                 cksum2 = kgnilnd_cksum_kiov(niov, dest, 0, nob - (n % nob), 1);
00125 
00126                 if (cksum != cksum2) {
00127                         CERROR("case %d loop %d different checksums %x expected %x\n",
00128                                j, n, cksum2, cksum);
00129                         GOTO(unwind, rc = -ENOKEY);
00130                 }
00131         }
00132 
00133         getnstimeofday(&end);
00134 
00135         mbytes = ((__u64)nloops * nob * 2) / (1024*1024);
00136 
00137         diff = kgnilnd_ts_sub(end, begin);
00138 
00139         LCONSOLE_INFO("running "LPD64"MB took %ld.%ld seconds\n",
00140                       mbytes, diff.tv_sec, diff.tv_nsec);
00141 
00142 unwind:
00143         CDEBUG(D_NET, "freeing %d pages\n", i);
00144         for (i -= 1; i >= 0; i--) {
00145                 if (src[i].kiov_page != NULL) {
00146                         __free_page(src[i].kiov_page);
00147                 }
00148                 if (dest[i].kiov_page != NULL) {
00149                         __free_page(dest[i].kiov_page);
00150                 }
00151         }
00152 
00153         if (src != NULL)
00154                 LIBCFS_FREE(src, LNET_MAX_IOV * sizeof(lnet_kiov_t));
00155         if (dest != NULL)
00156                 LIBCFS_FREE(dest, LNET_MAX_IOV * sizeof(lnet_kiov_t));
00157         return rc;
00158 }
00159 
00160 static ssize_t
00161 kgnilnd_proc_cksum_test_write(struct file *file, const char __user *ubuffer,
00162                               size_t count, loff_t *ppos)
00163 {
00164         char                    dummy[256 + 1] = { '\0' };
00165         int                     testno, nloops, nbytes;
00166         int                     rc;
00167         ENTRY;
00168 
00169         if (kgnilnd_data.kgn_init < GNILND_INIT_ALL) {
00170                 CERROR("can't run cksum test, kgnilnd is not initialized yet\n");
00171                 RETURN(-ENOSYS);
00172         }
00173 
00174         if (count >= sizeof(dummy) || count == 0)
00175                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00176 
00177         if (copy_from_user(dummy, ubuffer, count))
00178                 RETURN(-EFAULT);
00179 
00180         if (sscanf(dummy, "%d:%d:%d", &testno, &nloops, &nbytes) == 3) {
00181                 rc = _kgnilnd_proc_run_cksum_test(testno, nloops, nbytes);
00182                 if (rc < 0) {
00183                         RETURN(rc);
00184                 } else {
00185                         /* spurious, but lets us know the parse was ok */
00186                         RETURN(count);
00187                 }
00188         }
00189         RETURN(count);
00190 }
00191 
00192 static int
00193 kgnilnd_cksum_test_seq_open(struct inode *inode, struct file *file)
00194 {
00195         return single_open(file, NULL, PDE_DATA(inode));
00196 }

00198 static const struct file_operations kgn_cksum_test_fops = {
00199         .owner   = THIS_MODULE,
00200         .open    = kgnilnd_cksum_test_seq_open,
00201         .read    = seq_read,
00202         .write   = kgnilnd_proc_cksum_test_write,
00203         .llseek  = seq_lseek,
00204         .release = seq_release,
00205 };

00207 static int
00208 kgnilnd_stats_seq_show(struct seq_file *sf, void *v)
00209 {
00210         kgn_device_t           *dev;
00211         struct timeval          now;
00212         int                     rc;
00213 
00214         if (kgnilnd_data.kgn_init < GNILND_INIT_ALL) {
00215                 rc = seq_printf(sf, "kgnilnd is not initialized yet\n");
00216                 return rc;
00217         }
00218 
00219         /* only do the first device */
00220         dev = &kgnilnd_data.kgn_devices[0];
00221 
00222         /* sampling is racy, but so is reading this file! */
00223         smp_rmb();
00224         do_gettimeofday(&now);
00225 
00226         rc = seq_printf(sf, "time: %lu.%lu\n"
00227                            "ntx: %d\n"
00228                            "npeers: %d\n"
00229                            "nconns: %d\n"
00230                            "nEPs: %d\n"
00231                            "ndgrams: %d\n"
00232                            "nfmablk: %d\n"
00233                            "n_mdd: %d\n"
00234                            "n_mdd_held: %d\n"
00235                            "n_eager_allocs: %d\n"
00236                            "GART map bytes: %ld\n"
00237                            "TX queued maps: %d\n"
00238                            "TX phys nmaps: %d\n"
00239                            "TX phys bytes: %lu\n"
00240                            "TX virt nmaps: %d\n"
00241                            "TX virt bytes: "LPU64"\n"
00242                            "RDMAQ bytes_auth: %ld\n"
00243                            "RDMAQ bytes_left: %ld\n"
00244                            "RDMAQ nstalls: %d\n"
00245                            "dev mutex delay: %ld\n"
00246                            "dev n_yield: %d\n"
00247                            "dev n_schedule: %d\n"
00248                            "SMSG fast_try: %d\n"
00249                            "SMSG fast_ok: %d\n"
00250                            "SMSG fast_block: %d\n"
00251                            "SMSG ntx: %u\n"
00252                            "SMSG tx_bytes: %lu\n"
00253                            "SMSG nrx: %u\n"
00254                            "SMSG rx_bytes: %lu\n"
00255                            "RDMA ntx: %u\n"
00256                            "RDMA tx_bytes: %lu\n"
00257                            "RDMA nrx: %u\n"
00258                            "RDMA rx_bytes: %lu\n"
00259                            "VMAP short: %d\n"
00260                            "VMAP cksum: %d\n"
00261                            "KMAP short: %d\n"
00262                            "RDMA REV length: %d\n"
00263                            "RDMA REV offset: %d\n"
00264                            "RDMA REV copy: %d\n",
00265                 now.tv_sec, now.tv_usec,
00266                 atomic_read(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_ntx),
00267                 atomic_read(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_npeers),
00268                 atomic_read(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_nconns),
00269                 atomic_read(&dev->gnd_neps),
00270                 atomic_read(&dev->gnd_ndgrams),
00271                 atomic_read(&dev->gnd_nfmablk),
00272                 atomic_read(&dev->gnd_n_mdd), atomic_read(&dev->gnd_n_mdd_held),
00273                 atomic_read(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_neager_allocs),
00274                 atomic64_read(&dev->gnd_nbytes_map),
00275                 atomic_read(&dev->gnd_nq_map),
00276                 dev->gnd_map_nphys, dev->gnd_map_physnop * PAGE_SIZE,
00277                 dev->gnd_map_nvirt, dev->gnd_map_virtnob,
00278                 atomic64_read(&dev->gnd_rdmaq_bytes_out),
00279                 atomic64_read(&dev->gnd_rdmaq_bytes_ok),
00280                 atomic_read(&dev->gnd_rdmaq_nstalls),
00281                 dev->gnd_mutex_delay,
00282                 atomic_read(&dev->gnd_n_yield), atomic_read(&dev->gnd_n_schedule),
00283                 atomic_read(&dev->gnd_fast_try), atomic_read(&dev->gnd_fast_ok),
00284                 atomic_read(&dev->gnd_fast_block),
00285                 atomic_read(&dev->gnd_short_ntx), atomic64_read(&dev->gnd_short_txbytes),
00286                 atomic_read(&dev->gnd_short_nrx), atomic64_read(&dev->gnd_short_rxbytes),
00287                 atomic_read(&dev->gnd_rdma_ntx), atomic64_read(&dev->gnd_rdma_txbytes),
00288                 atomic_read(&dev->gnd_rdma_nrx), atomic64_read(&dev->gnd_rdma_rxbytes),
00289                 atomic_read(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_nvmap_short),
00290                 atomic_read(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_nvmap_cksum),
00291                 atomic_read(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_nkmap_short),
00292                 atomic_read(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_rev_length),
00293                 atomic_read(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_rev_offset),
00294                 atomic_read(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_rev_copy_buff));
00295 
00296         return rc;
00297 }
00298 
00299 static ssize_t
00300 kgnilnd_proc_stats_write(struct file *file, const char __user *ubuffer,
00301                          size_t count, loff_t *ppos)
00302 {
00303         kgn_device_t           *dev;
00304 
00305         if (kgnilnd_data.kgn_init < GNILND_INIT_ALL) {
00306                 CERROR("kgnilnd is not initialized for stats write\n");
00307                 return -EINVAL;
00308         }
00309 
00310         /* only do the first device */
00311         dev = &kgnilnd_data.kgn_devices[0];
00312 
00313         atomic_set(&dev->gnd_short_ntx, 0);
00314         atomic_set(&dev->gnd_short_nrx, 0);
00315         atomic64_set(&dev->gnd_short_txbytes, 0);
00316         atomic64_set(&dev->gnd_short_rxbytes, 0);
00317         atomic_set(&dev->gnd_rdma_ntx, 0);
00318         atomic_set(&dev->gnd_rdma_nrx, 0);
00319         atomic_set(&dev->gnd_fast_ok, 0);
00320         atomic_set(&dev->gnd_fast_try, 0);
00321         atomic_set(&dev->gnd_fast_block, 0);
00322         atomic64_set(&dev->gnd_rdma_txbytes, 0);
00323         atomic64_set(&dev->gnd_rdma_rxbytes, 0);
00324         atomic_set(&dev->gnd_rdmaq_nstalls, 0);
00325         set_mb(dev->gnd_mutex_delay, 0);
00326         atomic_set(&dev->gnd_n_yield, 0);
00327         atomic_set(&dev->gnd_n_schedule, 0);
00328         atomic_set(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_nvmap_short, 0);
00329         atomic_set(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_nvmap_cksum, 0);
00330         atomic_set(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_nkmap_short, 0);
00331         /* sampling is racy, but so is writing this file! */
00332         smp_wmb();
00333         return count;
00334 }
00335 
00336 static int
00337 kgnilnd_stats_seq_open(struct inode *inode, struct file *file)
00338 {
00339         return single_open(file, kgnilnd_stats_seq_show, PDE_DATA(inode));
00340 }

00342 static const struct file_operations kgn_stats_fops = {
00343         .owner   = THIS_MODULE,
00344         .open    = kgnilnd_stats_seq_open,
00345         .read    = seq_read,
00346         .write   = kgnilnd_proc_stats_write,
00347         .llseek  = seq_lseek,
00348         .release = seq_release,
00349 };
00350 
00351 typedef struct {
00352         kgn_device_t           *gmdd_dev;
00353         kgn_tx_t               *gmdd_tx;
00354         loff_t                  gmdd_off;
00355 } kgn_mdd_seq_iter_t;
00356 
00357 int
00358 kgnilnd_mdd_seq_seek(kgn_mdd_seq_iter_t *gseq, loff_t off)
00359 {
00360         kgn_tx_t                *tx;
00361         struct list_head        *r;
00362         loff_t                  here;
00363         int                     rc = 0;
00364 
00365         if (off == 0) {
00366                 gseq->gmdd_tx = NULL;
00367                 gseq->gmdd_off = 0;
00368                 return 0;
00369         }
00370 
00371         tx = gseq->gmdd_tx;
00372 
00373         if (tx == NULL || gseq->gmdd_off > off) {
00374                 /* search from start */
00375                 r = gseq->gmdd_dev->gnd_map_list.next;
00376                 here = 1;
00377         } else {
00378                 /* continue current search */
00379                 r = &tx->tx_map_list;
00380                 here = gseq->gmdd_off;
00381         }
00382 
00383         gseq->gmdd_off = off;
00384 
00385         while (r != &gseq->gmdd_dev->gnd_map_list) {
00386                 kgn_tx_t      *t;
00387 
00388                 t = list_entry(r, kgn_tx_t, tx_map_list);
00389 
00390                 if (here == off) {
00391                         gseq->gmdd_tx = t;
00392                         rc = 0;
00393                         goto out;
00394                 }
00395                 r = r->next;
00396                 here++;
00397         }
00398 
00399         gseq->gmdd_tx = NULL;
00400         rc = -ENOENT;
00401 out:
00402         return rc;
00403 }
00404 
00405 static void *
00406 kgnilnd_mdd_seq_start(struct seq_file *s, loff_t *pos)
00407 {
00408 
00409         kgn_mdd_seq_iter_t      *gseq;
00410         int                      rc;
00411 
00412         if (kgnilnd_data.kgn_init < GNILND_INIT_ALL) {
00413                 return NULL;
00414         }
00415 
00416         LIBCFS_ALLOC(gseq, sizeof(*gseq));
00417         if (gseq == NULL) {
00418                 CERROR("could not allocate mdd sequence iterator\n");
00419                 return NULL;
00420         }
00421 
00422         /* only doing device 0 for now */
00423         gseq->gmdd_dev = &kgnilnd_data.kgn_devices[0];
00424         gseq->gmdd_tx = NULL;
00425 
00426         /* need to lock map while we poke - huge disturbance
00427          * but without it, no way to get the data printed */
00428         spin_lock(&gseq->gmdd_dev->gnd_map_lock);
00429 
00430         /* set private to gseq for stop */
00431         s->private = gseq;
00432 
00433         rc = kgnilnd_mdd_seq_seek(gseq, *pos);
00434         if (rc == 0)
00435                 return gseq;
00436         else
00437                 return NULL;
00438 }
00439 
00440 static void
00441 kgnilnd_mdd_seq_stop(struct seq_file *s, void *iter)
00442 {
00443         kgn_mdd_seq_iter_t     *gseq = s->private;
00444 
00445         if (gseq != NULL) {
00446                 spin_unlock(&gseq->gmdd_dev->gnd_map_lock);
00447                 LIBCFS_FREE(gseq, sizeof(*gseq));
00448         }
00449 }
00450 
00451 static void *
00452 kgnilnd_mdd_seq_next(struct seq_file *s, void *iter, loff_t *pos)
00453 {
00454         kgn_mdd_seq_iter_t     *gseq = iter;
00455         int                     rc;
00456         loff_t                  next = *pos + 1;
00457 
00458         rc = kgnilnd_mdd_seq_seek(gseq, next);
00459         if (rc != 0) {
00460                 return NULL;
00461         }
00462         *pos = next;
00463         return gseq;
00464 }
00465 
00466 static int
00467 kgnilnd_mdd_seq_show(struct seq_file *s, void *iter)
00468 {
00469         kgn_mdd_seq_iter_t     *gseq = iter;
00470         kgn_tx_t               *tx;
00471         __u64                   nob;
00472         __u32                   physnop;
00473         int                     id;
00474         int                     buftype;
00475         gni_mem_handle_t        hndl;
00476 
00477         if (gseq->gmdd_off == 0) {
00478                 seq_printf(s, "%s %22s %16s %8s %8s %37s\n",
00479                         "tx", "tx_id", "nob", "physnop",
00480                         "buftype", "mem handle");
00481                 return 0;
00482         }
00483 
00484         tx = gseq->gmdd_tx;
00485         LASSERT(tx != NULL);
00486 
00487         id = tx->tx_id.txe_smsg_id;
00488         nob = tx->tx_nob;
00489         physnop = tx->tx_phys_npages;
00490         buftype = tx->tx_buftype;
00491         hndl.qword1 = tx->tx_map_key.qword1;
00492         hndl.qword2 = tx->tx_map_key.qword2;
00493 
00494         seq_printf(s, "%p %x %16"LPF64"u %8d %#8x "LPX64"."LPX64"x\n",
00495                 tx, id, nob, physnop, buftype,
00496                 hndl.qword1, hndl.qword2);
00497 
00498         return 0;
00499 }
00500 
00501 static struct seq_operations kgn_mdd_sops = {
00502         .start = kgnilnd_mdd_seq_start,
00503         .stop  = kgnilnd_mdd_seq_stop,
00504         .next  = kgnilnd_mdd_seq_next,
00505         .show  = kgnilnd_mdd_seq_show,
00506 
00507 };
00508 
00509 static int
00510 kgnilnd_mdd_seq_open(struct inode *inode, struct file *file)
00511 {
00512         struct seq_file       *sf;
00513         int                    rc;
00514 
00515         rc = seq_open(file, &kgn_mdd_sops);
00516         if (rc == 0) {
00517                 sf = file->private_data;
00518 
00519                 /* NULL means we've not yet open() */
00520                 sf->private = NULL;
00521         }
00522         return rc;
00523 }
00524 
00525 static struct file_operations kgn_mdd_fops = {
00526         .owner   = THIS_MODULE,
00527         .open    = kgnilnd_mdd_seq_open,
00528         .read    = seq_read,
00529         .llseek  = seq_lseek,
00530         .release = seq_release,
00531 };
00532 
00533 typedef struct {
00534         __u64                   gsmsg_version;
00535         kgn_device_t           *gsmsg_dev;
00536         kgn_fma_memblock_t     *gsmsg_fmablk;
00537         loff_t                  gsmsg_off;
00538 } kgn_smsg_seq_iter_t;
00539 
00540 int
00541 kgnilnd_smsg_seq_seek(kgn_smsg_seq_iter_t *gseq, loff_t off)
00542 {
00543         kgn_fma_memblock_t             *fmablk;
00544         kgn_device_t                   *dev;
00545         struct list_head               *r;
00546         loff_t                          here;
00547         int                             rc = 0;
00548 
00549         /* offset 0 is the header, so we start real entries at
00550          * here == off == 1 */
00551         if (off == 0) {
00552                 gseq->gsmsg_fmablk = NULL;
00553                 gseq->gsmsg_off = 0;
00554                 return 0;
00555         }
00556 
00557         fmablk = gseq->gsmsg_fmablk;
00558         dev = gseq->gsmsg_dev;
00559 
00560         spin_lock(&dev->gnd_fmablk_lock);
00561 
00562         if (fmablk != NULL &&
00563                 gseq->gsmsg_version != atomic_read(&dev->gnd_fmablk_vers)) {
00564                 /* list changed */
00565                 rc = -ESTALE;
00566                 goto out;
00567         }
00568 
00569         if (fmablk == NULL || gseq->gsmsg_off > off) {
00570                 /* search from start */
00571                 r = dev->gnd_fma_buffs.next;
00572                 here = 1;
00573         } else {
00574                 /* continue current search */
00575                 r = &fmablk->gnm_bufflist;
00576                 here = gseq->gsmsg_off;
00577         }
00578 
00579         gseq->gsmsg_version = atomic_read(&dev->gnd_fmablk_vers);
00580         gseq->gsmsg_off = off;
00581 
00582         while (r != &dev->gnd_fma_buffs) {
00583                 kgn_fma_memblock_t      *t;
00584 
00585                 t = list_entry(r, kgn_fma_memblock_t, gnm_bufflist);
00586 
00587                 if (here == off) {
00588                         gseq->gsmsg_fmablk = t;
00589                         rc = 0;
00590                         goto out;
00591                 }
00592                 r = r->next;
00593                 here++;
00594         }
00595 
00596         gseq->gsmsg_fmablk = NULL;
00597         rc = -ENOENT;
00598 out:
00599         spin_unlock(&dev->gnd_fmablk_lock);
00600         return rc;
00601 }
00602 
00603 static void *
00604 kgnilnd_smsg_seq_start(struct seq_file *s, loff_t *pos)
00605 {
00606 
00607         kgn_smsg_seq_iter_t     *gseq;
00608         int                      rc;
00609 
00610         if (kgnilnd_data.kgn_init < GNILND_INIT_ALL) {
00611                 return NULL;
00612         }
00613 
00614         LIBCFS_ALLOC(gseq, sizeof(*gseq));
00615         if (gseq == NULL) {
00616                 CERROR("could not allocate smsg sequence iterator\n");
00617                 return NULL;
00618         }
00619 
00620         /* only doing device 0 for now */
00621         gseq->gsmsg_dev = &kgnilnd_data.kgn_devices[0];
00622         gseq->gsmsg_fmablk = NULL;
00623         rc = kgnilnd_smsg_seq_seek(gseq, *pos);
00624         if (rc == 0)
00625                 return gseq;
00626 
00627         LIBCFS_FREE(gseq, sizeof(*gseq));
00628         return NULL;
00629 }
00630 
00631 static void
00632 kgnilnd_smsg_seq_stop(struct seq_file *s, void *iter)
00633 {
00634         kgn_smsg_seq_iter_t     *gseq = iter;
00635 
00636         if (gseq != NULL)
00637                 LIBCFS_FREE(gseq, sizeof(*gseq));
00638 }
00639 
00640 static void *
00641 kgnilnd_smsg_seq_next(struct seq_file *s, void *iter, loff_t *pos)
00642 {
00643         kgn_smsg_seq_iter_t    *gseq = iter;
00644         int                     rc;
00645         loff_t                  next = *pos + 1;
00646 
00647         rc = kgnilnd_smsg_seq_seek(gseq, next);
00648         if (rc != 0) {
00649                 LIBCFS_FREE(gseq, sizeof(*gseq));
00650                 return NULL;
00651         }
00652         *pos = next;
00653         return gseq;
00654 }
00655 
00656 static int
00657 kgnilnd_smsg_seq_show(struct seq_file *s, void *iter)
00658 {
00659         kgn_smsg_seq_iter_t    *gseq = iter;
00660         kgn_fma_memblock_t     *fmablk;
00661         kgn_device_t           *dev;
00662         int                     avail_mboxs, held_mboxs, num_mboxs;
00663         unsigned int            blk_size;
00664         int                     live;
00665         kgn_fmablk_state_t      state;
00666         gni_mem_handle_t        hndl;
00667 
00668         if (gseq->gsmsg_off == 0) {
00669                 seq_printf(s, "%5s %4s %6s/%5s/%5s %9s %18s %37s\n",
00670                         "blk#", "type", "avail", "held", "total", "size",
00671                         "fmablk", "mem handle");
00672                 return 0;
00673         }
00674 
00675         fmablk = gseq->gsmsg_fmablk;
00676         dev = gseq->gsmsg_dev;
00677         LASSERT(fmablk != NULL);
00678 
00679         spin_lock(&dev->gnd_fmablk_lock);
00680 
00681         if (gseq->gsmsg_version != atomic_read(&dev->gnd_fmablk_vers)) {
00682                 /* list changed */
00683                 spin_unlock(&dev->gnd_fmablk_lock);
00684                 return -ESTALE;
00685         }
00686 
00687         live = fmablk->gnm_hold_timeout == 0;
00688         /* none are available if it isn't live... */
00689         avail_mboxs = live ? fmablk->gnm_avail_mboxs : 0;
00690         held_mboxs = fmablk->gnm_held_mboxs;
00691         num_mboxs = fmablk->gnm_num_mboxs;
00692         blk_size = fmablk->gnm_blk_size;
00693         state = fmablk->gnm_state;
00694         hndl.qword1 = fmablk->gnm_hndl.qword1;
00695         hndl.qword2 = fmablk->gnm_hndl.qword2;
00696 
00697         spin_unlock(&dev->gnd_fmablk_lock);
00698 
00699         if (live) {
00700                 seq_printf(s, "%5d %4s %6d/%5d/%5d %9d %18p   "LPX64"."LPX64"\n",
00701                            (int) gseq->gsmsg_off, kgnilnd_fmablk_state2str(state),
00702                            avail_mboxs, held_mboxs, num_mboxs, blk_size,
00703                            fmablk, hndl.qword1, hndl.qword2);
00704         } else {
00705                 seq_printf(s, "%5d %4s %6d/%5d/%5d %9d %18p %37s\n",
00706                            (int) gseq->gsmsg_off, kgnilnd_fmablk_state2str(state),
00707                            avail_mboxs, held_mboxs, num_mboxs, blk_size,
00708                            fmablk, "PURGATORY.HOLD");
00709         }
00710 
00711         return 0;
00712 }
00713 
00714 static struct seq_operations kgn_smsg_sops = {
00715         .start = kgnilnd_smsg_seq_start,
00716         .stop  = kgnilnd_smsg_seq_stop,
00717         .next  = kgnilnd_smsg_seq_next,
00718         .show  = kgnilnd_smsg_seq_show,
00719 
00720 };
00721 
00722 static int
00723 kgnilnd_smsg_seq_open(struct inode *inode, struct file *file)
00724 {
00725         struct seq_file       *sf;
00726         int                    rc;
00727 
00728         rc = seq_open(file, &kgn_smsg_sops);
00729         if (rc == 0) {
00730                 sf = file->private_data;
00731                 sf->private = PDE_DATA(inode);
00732         }
00733 
00734         return rc;
00735 }
00736 
00737 static struct file_operations kgn_smsg_fops = {
00738         .owner   = THIS_MODULE,
00739         .open    = kgnilnd_smsg_seq_open,
00740         .read    = seq_read,
00741         .llseek  = seq_lseek,
00742         .release = seq_release,
00743 };
00744 
00745 typedef struct {
00746         __u64                   gconn_version;
00747         struct list_head       *gconn_list;
00748         kgn_conn_t             *gconn_conn;
00749         loff_t                  gconn_off;
00750         int                     gconn_hashidx;
00751 } kgn_conn_seq_iter_t;
00752 
00753 int
00754 kgnilnd_conn_seq_seek(kgn_conn_seq_iter_t *gseq, loff_t off)
00755 {
00756         struct list_head       *list, *tmp;
00757         loff_t                  here = 0;
00758         int                     rc = 0;
00759 
00760         if (off == 0) {
00761                 gseq->gconn_hashidx = 0;
00762                 gseq->gconn_list = NULL;
00763         }
00764 
00765         if (off > atomic_read(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_nconns)) {
00766                 gseq->gconn_list = NULL;
00767                 rc = -ENOENT;
00768         }
00769 
00770         read_lock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock);
00771         if (gseq->gconn_list != NULL &&
00772                 gseq->gconn_version != kgnilnd_data.kgn_conn_version) {
00773                 /* list changed */
00774                 rc = -ESTALE;
00775                 goto out;
00776         }
00777 
00778         if ((gseq->gconn_list == NULL) ||
00779                 (gseq->gconn_off > off) ||
00780                 (gseq->gconn_hashidx >= *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_peer_hash_size)) {
00781                 /* search from start */
00782                 gseq->gconn_hashidx = 0;
00783                 list = &kgnilnd_data.kgn_conns[gseq->gconn_hashidx];
00784                 here = 0;
00785         } else {
00786                 /* continue current search */
00787                 list = gseq->gconn_list;
00788         }
00789 
00790         gseq->gconn_version = kgnilnd_data.kgn_conn_version;
00791         gseq->gconn_off = off;
00792 
00793 start_list:
00794 
00795         list_for_each(tmp, list) {
00796                 if (here == off) {
00797                         kgn_conn_t *conn;
00798                         conn = list_entry(tmp, kgn_conn_t, gnc_hashlist);
00799                         gseq->gconn_conn = conn;
00800                         rc = 0;
00801                         goto out;
00802                 }
00803                 here++;
00804         }
00805         /* if we got through this hash bucket with 'off' still to go, try next*/
00806         gseq->gconn_hashidx++;
00807         if ((here <= off) &&
00808                 (gseq->gconn_hashidx < *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_peer_hash_size)) {
00809                 list = &kgnilnd_data.kgn_conns[gseq->gconn_hashidx];
00810                 goto start_list;
00811         }
00812 
00813         gseq->gconn_list = NULL;
00814         rc = -ENOENT;
00815 out:
00816         read_unlock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock);
00817         return rc;
00818 }
00819 
00820 static void *
00821 kgnilnd_conn_seq_start(struct seq_file *s, loff_t *pos)
00822 {
00823 
00824         kgn_conn_seq_iter_t     *gseq;
00825         int                      rc;
00826 
00827         if (kgnilnd_data.kgn_init < GNILND_INIT_ALL) {
00828                 return NULL;
00829         }
00830 
00831         LIBCFS_ALLOC(gseq, sizeof(*gseq));
00832         if (gseq == NULL) {
00833                 CERROR("could not allocate conn sequence iterator\n");
00834                 return NULL;
00835         }
00836 
00837         /* only doing device 0 for now */
00838         gseq->gconn_list = NULL;
00839         rc = kgnilnd_conn_seq_seek(gseq, *pos);
00840         if (rc == 0)
00841                 return gseq;
00842 
00843         LIBCFS_FREE(gseq, sizeof(*gseq));
00844         return NULL;
00845 }
00846 
00847 static void
00848 kgnilnd_conn_seq_stop(struct seq_file *s, void *iter)
00849 {
00850         kgn_conn_seq_iter_t     *gseq = iter;
00851 
00852         if (gseq != NULL)
00853                 LIBCFS_FREE(gseq, sizeof(*gseq));
00854 }
00855 
00856 static void *
00857 kgnilnd_conn_seq_next(struct seq_file *s, void *iter, loff_t *pos)
00858 {
00859         kgn_conn_seq_iter_t    *gseq = iter;
00860         int                     rc;
00861         loff_t                  next = *pos + 1;
00862 
00863         rc = kgnilnd_conn_seq_seek(gseq, next);
00864         if (rc != 0) {
00865                 LIBCFS_FREE(gseq, sizeof(*gseq));
00866                 return NULL;
00867         }
00868         *pos = next;
00869         return gseq;
00870 }
00871 
00872 static int
00873 kgnilnd_conn_seq_show(struct seq_file *s, void *iter)
00874 {
00875         kgn_conn_seq_iter_t    *gseq = iter;
00876         kgn_peer_t             *peer = NULL;
00877         kgn_conn_t             *conn;
00878 
00879         /* there is no header data for conns, so offset 0 is the first
00880          * real entry. */
00881 
00882         conn = gseq->gconn_conn;
00883         LASSERT(conn != NULL);
00884 
00885         read_lock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock);
00886         if (gseq->gconn_list != NULL &&
00887                 gseq->gconn_version != kgnilnd_data.kgn_conn_version) {
00888                 /* list changed */
00889                 read_unlock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock);
00890                 return -ESTALE;
00891         }
00892 
00893         /* instead of saving off the data, just refcount */
00894         kgnilnd_conn_addref(conn);
00895         if (conn->gnc_peer) {
00896                 /* don't use link - after unlock it could get nuked */
00897                 peer = conn->gnc_peer;
00898                 kgnilnd_peer_addref(peer);
00899         }
00900 
00901         read_unlock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock);
00902 
00903         seq_printf(s, "%p->%s [%d] q %d/%d/%d "
00904                 "tx sq %u %dms/%dms "
00905                 "rx sq %u %dms/%dms "
00906                 "noop r/s %d/%d w/s/cq %lds/%lds/%lds "
00907                 "sched a/d %lds/%lds "
00908                 "tx_re "LPD64" TO %ds %s\n",
00909                 conn, peer ? libcfs_nid2str(peer->gnp_nid) : "<?>",
00910                 atomic_read(&conn->gnc_refcount),
00911                 kgnilnd_count_list(&conn->gnc_fmaq),
00912                 atomic_read(&conn->gnc_nlive_fma),
00913                 atomic_read(&conn->gnc_nlive_rdma),
00914                 atomic_read(&conn->gnc_tx_seq),
00915                 jiffies_to_msecs(jiffies - conn->gnc_last_tx),
00916                 jiffies_to_msecs(jiffies - conn->gnc_last_tx_cq),
00917                 atomic_read(&conn->gnc_rx_seq),
00918                 jiffies_to_msecs(jiffies - conn->gnc_last_rx),
00919                 jiffies_to_msecs(jiffies - conn->gnc_last_rx_cq),
00920                 atomic_read(&conn->gnc_reaper_noop),
00921                 atomic_read(&conn->gnc_sched_noop),
00922                 cfs_duration_sec(jiffies - conn->gnc_last_noop_want),
00923                 cfs_duration_sec(jiffies - conn->gnc_last_noop_sent),
00924                 cfs_duration_sec(jiffies - conn->gnc_last_noop_cq),
00925                 cfs_duration_sec(jiffies - conn->gnc_last_sched_ask),
00926                 cfs_duration_sec(jiffies - conn->gnc_last_sched_do),
00927                 conn->gnc_tx_retrans, conn->gnc_timeout,
00928                 kgnilnd_conn_state2str(conn));
00929 
00930         if (peer)
00931                 kgnilnd_peer_decref(peer);
00932         kgnilnd_conn_decref(conn);
00933 
00934         return 0;
00935 }
00936 
00937 static struct seq_operations kgn_conn_sops = {
00938         .start = kgnilnd_conn_seq_start,
00939         .stop  = kgnilnd_conn_seq_stop,
00940         .next  = kgnilnd_conn_seq_next,
00941         .show  = kgnilnd_conn_seq_show,
00942 
00943 };
00944 
00945 #define KGN_DEBUG_PEER_NID_DEFAULT -1
00946 static int kgnilnd_debug_peer_nid = KGN_DEBUG_PEER_NID_DEFAULT;
00947 
00948 static ssize_t
00949 kgnilnd_proc_peer_conns_write(struct file *file, const char __user *ubuffer,
00950                               size_t count, loff_t *ppos)
00951 {
00952         char dummy[8];
00953         int  rc;
00954 
00955         if (count >= sizeof(dummy) || count == 0)
00956                 return -EINVAL;
00957 
00958         if (copy_from_user(dummy, ubuffer, count))
00959                 return -EFAULT;
00960 
00961         rc = sscanf(dummy, "%d", &kgnilnd_debug_peer_nid);
00962 
00963         if (rc != 1) {
00964                 return -EINVAL;
00965         }
00966 
00967         RETURN(count);
00968 }
00969 
00970 /* debug data to print from conns associated with peer nid
00971   -  date/time
00972   -  peer nid
00973   -  mbox_addr (msg_buffer + mbox_offset)
00974   -  gnc_dgram_type
00975   -  gnc_in_purgatory
00976   -  gnc_state
00977   -  gnc_error
00978   -  gnc_peer_error
00979   -  gnc_tx_seq
00980   -  gnc_last_tx
00981   -  gnc_last_tx_cq
00982   -  gnc_rx_seq
00983   -  gnc_first_rx
00984   -  gnc_last_rx
00985   -  gnc_last_rx_cq
00986   -  gnc_tx_retrans
00987   -  gnc_close_sent
00988   -  gnc_close_recvd
00989 */
00990 
00991 static int
00992 kgnilnd_proc_peer_conns_seq_show(struct seq_file *sf, void *v)
00993 {
00994         kgn_peer_t      *peer;
00995         kgn_conn_t      *conn;
00996         struct tm       ctm;
00997         struct timespec now;
00998         unsigned long   jifs;
00999         int             rc = 0;
01000 
01001         if (kgnilnd_debug_peer_nid == KGN_DEBUG_PEER_NID_DEFAULT) {
01002                 rc = seq_printf(sf, "peer_conns not initialized\n");
01003                 return rc;
01004         }
01005 
01006         /* sample date/time stamp - print time in UTC
01007          * 2012-12-11T16:06:16.966751 123@gni ...
01008          */
01009         getnstimeofday(&now);
01010         time_to_tm(now.tv_sec, 0, &ctm);
01011         jifs = jiffies;
01012 
01013         write_lock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock);
01014         peer = kgnilnd_find_peer_locked(kgnilnd_debug_peer_nid);
01015 
01016         if (peer == NULL) {
01017                 rc = seq_printf(sf, "peer not found for this nid %d\n",
01018                              kgnilnd_debug_peer_nid);
01019                 write_unlock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock);
01020                 return rc;
01021         }
01022 
01023         list_for_each_entry(conn, &peer->gnp_conns, gnc_list) {
01024                 rc = seq_printf(sf,
01025                         "%04ld-%02d-%02dT%02d:%02d:%02d.%06ld %s "
01026                         "mbox adr %p "
01027                         "dg type %s "
01028                         "%s "
01029                         "purg %d "
01030                         "close s/r %d/%d "
01031                         "err %d peer err %d "
01032                         "tx sq %u %dms/%dms "
01033                         "rx sq %u %dms/%dms/%dms "
01034                         "tx retran %lld\n",
01035                         ctm.tm_year+1900, ctm.tm_mon+1, ctm.tm_mday,
01036                         ctm.tm_hour, ctm.tm_min, ctm.tm_sec, now.tv_nsec,
01037                         libcfs_nid2str(peer->gnp_nid),
01038                         conn->remote_mbox_addr,
01039                         kgnilnd_conn_dgram_type2str(conn->gnc_dgram_type),
01040                         kgnilnd_conn_state2str(conn),
01041                         conn->gnc_in_purgatory,
01042                         conn->gnc_close_sent,
01043                         conn->gnc_close_recvd,
01044                         conn->gnc_error,
01045                         conn->gnc_peer_error,
01046                         atomic_read(&conn->gnc_tx_seq),
01047                         jiffies_to_msecs(jifs - conn->gnc_last_tx),
01048                         jiffies_to_msecs(jifs - conn->gnc_last_tx_cq),
01049                         atomic_read(&conn->gnc_rx_seq),
01050                         jiffies_to_msecs(jifs - conn->gnc_first_rx),
01051                         jiffies_to_msecs(jifs - conn->gnc_last_rx),
01052                         jiffies_to_msecs(jifs - conn->gnc_last_rx_cq),
01053                         conn->gnc_tx_retrans);
01054         }
01055 
01056         write_unlock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock);
01057         return rc;
01058 }
01059 
01060 static int
01061 kgnilnd_peer_conns_seq_open(struct inode *inode, struct file *file)
01062 {
01063         return single_open(file, kgnilnd_proc_peer_conns_seq_show,
01064                            PDE_DATA(inode));
01065 }
01066 
01067 static const struct file_operations kgn_peer_conns_fops = {
01068         .owner   = THIS_MODULE,
01069         .open    = kgnilnd_peer_conns_seq_open,
01070         .read    = seq_read,
01071         .write   = kgnilnd_proc_peer_conns_write,
01072         .llseek  = seq_lseek,
01073         .release = seq_release,
01074 };
01075 
01076 static int
01077 kgnilnd_conn_seq_open(struct inode *inode, struct file *file)
01078 {
01079         struct seq_file       *sf;
01080         int                    rc;
01081 
01082         rc = seq_open(file, &kgn_conn_sops);
01083         if (rc == 0) {
01084                 sf = file->private_data;
01085                 sf->private = PDE_DATA(inode);
01086         }
01087 
01088         return rc;
01089 }
01090 
01091 static struct file_operations kgn_conn_fops = {
01092         .owner   = THIS_MODULE,
01093         .open    = kgnilnd_conn_seq_open,
01094         .read    = seq_read,
01095         .llseek  = seq_lseek,
01096         .release = seq_release,
01097 };
01098 
01099 typedef struct {
01100         __u64                   gpeer_version;
01101         struct list_head       *gpeer_list;
01102         kgn_peer_t             *gpeer_peer;
01103         loff_t                  gpeer_off;
01104         int                     gpeer_hashidx;
01105 } kgn_peer_seq_iter_t;
01106 
01107 int
01108 kgnilnd_peer_seq_seek(kgn_peer_seq_iter_t *gseq, loff_t off)
01109 {
01110         struct list_head       *list, *tmp;
01111         loff_t                  here = 0;
01112         int                     rc = 0;
01113 
01114         if (off == 0) {
01115                 gseq->gpeer_hashidx = 0;
01116                 gseq->gpeer_list = NULL;
01117         }
01118 
01119         if (off > atomic_read(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_npeers)) {
01120                 gseq->gpeer_list = NULL;
01121                 rc = -ENOENT;
01122         }
01123 
01124         read_lock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock);
01125         if (gseq->gpeer_list != NULL &&
01126                 gseq->gpeer_version != kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_version) {
01127                 /* list changed */
01128                 rc = -ESTALE;
01129                 goto out;
01130         }
01131 
01132         if ((gseq->gpeer_list == NULL) ||
01133                 (gseq->gpeer_off > off) ||
01134                 (gseq->gpeer_hashidx >= *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_peer_hash_size)) {
01135                 /* search from start */
01136                 gseq->gpeer_hashidx = 0;
01137                 list = &kgnilnd_data.kgn_peers[gseq->gpeer_hashidx];
01138                 here = 0;
01139         } else {
01140                 /* continue current search */
01141                 list = gseq->gpeer_list;
01142         }
01143 
01144         gseq->gpeer_version = kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_version;
01145         gseq->gpeer_off = off;
01146 
01147 start_list:
01148 
01149         list_for_each(tmp, list) {
01150                 if (here == off) {
01151                         kgn_peer_t *peer;
01152                         peer = list_entry(tmp, kgn_peer_t, gnp_list);
01153                         gseq->gpeer_peer = peer;
01154                         rc = 0;
01155                         goto out;
01156                 }
01157                 here++;
01158         }
01159         /* if we got through this hash bucket with 'off' still to go, try next*/
01160         gseq->gpeer_hashidx++;
01161         if ((here <= off) &&
01162                 (gseq->gpeer_hashidx < *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_peer_hash_size)) {
01163                 list = &kgnilnd_data.kgn_peers[gseq->gpeer_hashidx];
01164                 goto start_list;
01165         }
01166 
01167         gseq->gpeer_list = NULL;
01168         rc = -ENOENT;
01169 out:
01170         read_unlock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock);
01171         return rc;
01172 }
01173 
01174 static void *
01175 kgnilnd_peer_seq_start(struct seq_file *s, loff_t *pos)
01176 {
01177 
01178         kgn_peer_seq_iter_t     *gseq;
01179         int                      rc;
01180 
01181         if (kgnilnd_data.kgn_init < GNILND_INIT_ALL) {
01182                 return NULL;
01183         }
01184 
01185         LIBCFS_ALLOC(gseq, sizeof(*gseq));
01186         if (gseq == NULL) {
01187                 CERROR("could not allocate peer sequence iterator\n");
01188                 return NULL;
01189         }
01190 
01191         /* only doing device 0 for now */
01192         gseq->gpeer_list = NULL;
01193         rc = kgnilnd_peer_seq_seek(gseq, *pos);
01194         if (rc == 0)
01195                 return gseq;
01196 
01197         LIBCFS_FREE(gseq, sizeof(*gseq));
01198         return NULL;
01199 }
01200 
01201 static void
01202 kgnilnd_peer_seq_stop(struct seq_file *s, void *iter)
01203 {
01204         kgn_peer_seq_iter_t     *gseq = iter;
01205 
01206         if (gseq != NULL)
01207                 LIBCFS_FREE(gseq, sizeof(*gseq));
01208 }
01209 
01210 static void *
01211 kgnilnd_peer_seq_next(struct seq_file *s, void *iter, loff_t *pos)
01212 {
01213         kgn_peer_seq_iter_t    *gseq = iter;
01214         int                     rc;
01215         loff_t                  next = *pos + 1;
01216 
01217         rc = kgnilnd_peer_seq_seek(gseq, next);
01218         if (rc != 0) {
01219                 LIBCFS_FREE(gseq, sizeof(*gseq));
01220                 return NULL;
01221         }
01222         *pos = next;
01223         return gseq;
01224 }
01225 
01226 static int
01227 kgnilnd_peer_seq_show(struct seq_file *s, void *iter)
01228 {
01229         kgn_peer_seq_iter_t    *gseq = iter;
01230         kgn_peer_t             *peer;
01231         kgn_conn_t             *conn;
01232         char                   conn_str;
01233         int                    purg_count = 0;
01234         /* there is no header data for peers, so offset 0 is the first
01235          * real entry. */
01236 
01237         peer = gseq->gpeer_peer;
01238         LASSERT(peer != NULL);
01239 
01240         read_lock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock);
01241         if (gseq->gpeer_list != NULL &&
01242                 gseq->gpeer_version != kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_version) {
01243                 /* list changed */
01244                 read_unlock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock);
01245                 return -ESTALE;
01246         }
01247 
01248         /* instead of saving off the data, just refcount */
01249         kgnilnd_peer_addref(peer);
01250         conn = kgnilnd_find_conn_locked(peer);
01251 
01252         if (peer->gnp_connecting) {
01253                 conn_str = 'S';
01254         } else if (conn != NULL) {
01255                 conn_str = 'C';
01256         } else {
01257                 conn_str = 'D';
01258         }
01259 
01260         list_for_each_entry(conn, &peer->gnp_conns, gnc_list) {
01261                 if (conn->gnc_in_purgatory) {
01262                         purg_count++;
01263                 }
01264         }
01265 
01266         read_unlock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock);
01267 
01268         seq_printf(s, "%p->%s [%d] %s NIC 0x%x q %d conn %c purg %d "
01269                 "last %d@%dms dgram %d@%dms "
01270                 "reconn %dms to %lus \n",
01271                 peer, libcfs_nid2str(peer->gnp_nid),
01272                 atomic_read(&peer->gnp_refcount),
01273                 (peer->gnp_down == GNILND_RCA_NODE_DOWN) ? "down" : "up",
01274                 peer->gnp_host_id,
01275                 kgnilnd_count_list(&peer->gnp_tx_queue),
01276                 conn_str,
01277                 purg_count,
01278                 peer->gnp_last_errno,
01279                 jiffies_to_msecs(jiffies - peer->gnp_last_alive),
01280                 peer->gnp_last_dgram_errno,
01281                 jiffies_to_msecs(jiffies - peer->gnp_last_dgram_time),
01282                 peer->gnp_reconnect_interval != 0
01283                         ? jiffies_to_msecs(jiffies - peer->gnp_reconnect_time)
01284                         : 0,
01285                 peer->gnp_reconnect_interval);
01286 
01287         kgnilnd_peer_decref(peer);
01288 
01289         return 0;
01290 }
01291 
01292 static struct seq_operations kgn_peer_sops = {
01293         .start = kgnilnd_peer_seq_start,
01294         .stop  = kgnilnd_peer_seq_stop,
01295         .next  = kgnilnd_peer_seq_next,
01296         .show  = kgnilnd_peer_seq_show,
01297 };
01298 
01299 static int
01300 kgnilnd_peer_seq_open(struct inode *inode, struct file *file)
01301 {
01302         struct seq_file       *sf;
01303         int                    rc;
01304 
01305         rc = seq_open(file, &kgn_peer_sops);
01306         if (rc == 0) {
01307                 sf = file->private_data;
01308                 sf->private = PDE_DATA(inode);
01309         }
01310 
01311         return rc;
01312 }
01313 
01314 static struct file_operations kgn_peer_fops = {
01315         .owner   = THIS_MODULE,
01316         .open    = kgnilnd_peer_seq_open,
01317         .read    = seq_read,
01318         .llseek  = seq_lseek,
01319         .release = seq_release,
01320 };
01321 
01322 static struct proc_dir_entry *kgn_proc_root;
01323 
01324 void
01325 kgnilnd_proc_init(void)
01326 {
01327         struct proc_dir_entry *pde;
01328         int             rc = 0;
01329         ENTRY;
01330 
01331         /* setup dir */
01332         kgn_proc_root = proc_mkdir(libcfs_lnd2modname(GNILND), NULL);
01333         if (kgn_proc_root == NULL) {
01334                 CERROR("couldn't create proc dir %s\n",
01335                         libcfs_lnd2modname(GNILND));
01336                 return;
01337         }
01338 
01339         /* Initialize CKSUM_TEST */
01340         pde = proc_create(GNILND_PROC_CKSUM_TEST, 0200, kgn_proc_root,
01341                           &kgn_cksum_test_fops);
01342         if (pde == NULL) {
01343                 CERROR("couldn't create proc entry %s\n", GNILND_PROC_CKSUM_TEST);
01344                 GOTO(remove_dir, rc = -ENOENT);
01345         }
01346 
01347         /* Initialize STATS */
01348         pde = proc_create(GNILND_PROC_STATS, 0644, kgn_proc_root,
01349                           &kgn_stats_fops);
01350         if (pde == NULL) {
01351                 CERROR("couldn't create proc entry %s\n", GNILND_PROC_STATS);
01352                 GOTO(remove_test, rc = -ENOENT);
01353         }
01354 
01355         /* Initialize MDD */
01356         pde = proc_create(GNILND_PROC_MDD, 0444, kgn_proc_root, &kgn_mdd_fops);
01357         if (pde == NULL) {
01358                 CERROR("couldn't create proc entry %s\n", GNILND_PROC_MDD);
01359                 GOTO(remove_stats, rc = -ENOENT);
01360         }
01361 
01362         /* Initialize SMSG */
01363         pde = proc_create(GNILND_PROC_SMSG, 0444, kgn_proc_root,
01364                           &kgn_smsg_fops);
01365         if (pde == NULL) {
01366                 CERROR("couldn't create proc entry %s\n", GNILND_PROC_SMSG);
01367                 GOTO(remove_mdd, rc = -ENOENT);
01368         }
01369 
01370         /* Initialize CONN */
01371         pde = proc_create(GNILND_PROC_CONN, 0444, kgn_proc_root,
01372                           &kgn_conn_fops);
01373         if (pde == NULL) {
01374                 CERROR("couldn't create proc entry %s\n", GNILND_PROC_CONN);
01375                 GOTO(remove_smsg, rc = -ENOENT);
01376         }
01377 
01378         /* Initialize peer conns debug */
01379         pde = proc_create(GNILND_PROC_PEER_CONNS, 0644, kgn_proc_root,
01380                           &kgn_peer_conns_fops);
01381         if (pde == NULL) {
01382                 CERROR("couldn't create proc entry %s\n", GNILND_PROC_PEER_CONNS);
01383                 GOTO(remove_conn, rc = -ENOENT);
01384         }
01385 
01386         /* Initialize PEER */
01387         pde = proc_create(GNILND_PROC_PEER, 0444, kgn_proc_root,
01388                           &kgn_peer_fops);
01389         if (pde == NULL) {
01390                 CERROR("couldn't create proc entry %s\n", GNILND_PROC_PEER);
01391                 GOTO(remove_pc, rc = -ENOENT);
01392         }
01393         RETURN_EXIT;
01394 
01395 remove_pc:
01396         remove_proc_entry(GNILND_PROC_PEER_CONNS, kgn_proc_root);
01397 remove_conn:
01398         remove_proc_entry(GNILND_PROC_CONN, kgn_proc_root);
01399 remove_smsg:
01400         remove_proc_entry(GNILND_PROC_SMSG, kgn_proc_root);
01401 remove_mdd:
01402         remove_proc_entry(GNILND_PROC_MDD, kgn_proc_root);
01403 remove_stats:
01404         remove_proc_entry(GNILND_PROC_STATS, kgn_proc_root);
01405 remove_test:
01406         remove_proc_entry(GNILND_PROC_CKSUM_TEST, kgn_proc_root);
01407 remove_dir:
01408         remove_proc_entry(libcfs_lnd2modname(GNILND), NULL);
01409 
01410         RETURN_EXIT;
01411 }
01412 
01413 void
01414 kgnilnd_proc_fini(void)
01415 {
01416         remove_proc_entry(GNILND_PROC_PEER_CONNS, kgn_proc_root);
01417         remove_proc_entry(GNILND_PROC_PEER, kgn_proc_root);
01418         remove_proc_entry(GNILND_PROC_CONN, kgn_proc_root);
01419         remove_proc_entry(GNILND_PROC_MDD, kgn_proc_root);
01420         remove_proc_entry(GNILND_PROC_SMSG, kgn_proc_root);
01421         remove_proc_entry(GNILND_PROC_STATS, kgn_proc_root);
01422         remove_proc_entry(GNILND_PROC_CKSUM_TEST, kgn_proc_root);
01423         remove_proc_entry(libcfs_lnd2modname(GNILND), NULL);
01424 }
